channel.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
channel.description:
Hey guys, well I was thinking of making my server a Dedi server, but I want to make it so they have to register on the forums, and well, me being me, I suck at mySQL things xD and I was hoping if someone could give me, or help me out, with whatever to do, to make it like that ? :S
*[size=7pt]I want to make it a Dedi server because alot of people will be on at a time, and I don't want alot of nulls, and spammers or whatever. anyways, thanks.[/size]

item.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“sw1tchez, post:15, topic:229598”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=302067.msg2423544#msg2423544 date=1220472588]
ah, any forum can be used for servers, vB is just the most professional forum out there (costs money, of course)
[/quote]
Oh, alright. Well i’ll keep reading that JDBC stuff, thanks a ton for the help :)[/quote]
yup, no problem, it may be a bit confusing to you at first, but it should get less confusing when you learn it more

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
item.dc:creator: @sw1tchez sw1tchez
item.description:
@sw1tchez wrote:

[quote=“Hidendra, post:12, topic:229598”][quote author=sw1tchez link=topic=302067.msg2423536#msg2423536 date=1220472251]

All you will basically need for what you need (I’m assuming user accounts), is connecting, executing queries and updates, also using ResultSet. so…
connect, executeQuery() (prepare for ResultSet), executeUpdate() (insert and update the tables), and using ResultSet to read rows from the database.

Notenotenote: you cannot do this with SMFFORFREE or anything like it, you must have MySQL access to the database the forum is hosted on.

Yes, I know, i’m using ULMB to host my forums, is that good?

If you’re going to have a dedi, I highly suggest you host the forums alongside the server on the dedi; that way you won’t have any problems… Because ULMB does not provide remote sql, you have to access mysql from php on their websites. They don’t provide accessing mysql remotely due to security reasons (bruteforce attacks, etc)

Ohh, alright, well I see alot of people like using uhmm ahh whats it called… the thing palidino uses… RL uses it now… lol xD I can’t remember it, rune == server uses it too xD lol, well, Palidino uses it, and he makes it so people need to register on it too? :S
[/quote]
VPS? VPS = Virtual Dedicated Server, basically in 1 dedicated server there can be 5-10 maybe more VPS’s, and you are guaranteed 128-1gb ram, whatever you pay for. Cheaper than a dedicated if you don’t need the full features of a dedi but need root access that shared hosting can’t provide.[/quote]
Actually I remembered it it was vBulletin (well the forums, if that has anything to do with it)

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“sw1tchez, post:11, topic:229598”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=302067.msg2423535#msg2423535 date=1220472034]

All you will basically need for what you need (I’m assuming user accounts), is connecting, executing queries and updates, also using ResultSet. so…
connect, executeQuery() (prepare for ResultSet), executeUpdate() (insert and update the tables), and using ResultSet to read rows from the database.

Notenotenote: you cannot do this with SMFFORFREE or anything like it, you must have MySQL access to the database the forum is hosted on.

Yes, I know, i’m using ULMB to host my forums, is that good?

If you’re going to have a dedi, I highly suggest you host the forums alongside the server on the dedi; that way you won’t have any problems… Because ULMB does not provide remote sql, you have to access mysql from php on their websites. They don’t provide accessing mysql remotely due to security reasons (bruteforce attacks, etc)
[/quote]
Ohh, alright, well I see alot of people like using uhmm ahh whats it called… the thing palidino uses… RL uses it now… lol xD I can’t remember it, rune == server uses it too xD lol, well, Palidino uses it, and he makes it so people need to register on it too? :S[/quote]
VPS? VPS = Virtual Dedicated Server, basically in 1 dedicated server there can be 5-10 maybe more VPS’s, and you are guaranteed 128-1gb ram, whatever you pay for. Cheaper than a dedicated if you don’t need the full features of a dedi but need root access that shared hosting can’t provide.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

All you will basically need for what you need (I’m assuming user accounts), is connecting, executing queries and updates, also using ResultSet. so…
connect, executeQuery() (prepare for ResultSet), executeUpdate() (insert and update the tables), and using ResultSet to read rows from the database.

Notenotenote: you cannot do this with SMFFORFREE or anything like it, you must have MySQL access to the database the forum is hosted on.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Help, [Rep+]
item.dc:creator: @sw1tchez sw1tchez
item.description:
@sw1tchez wrote:

Well this is what I found, (theres more, this just sounded like it was most important)[code]Mapping MySQL Data Types in Java
Data types of MySQL and Java programming language are not same, its need some mechanism for transferring data between an database using MySQL data types and a application using Java data types.

Connecting to a MySQL Database in Java
In this section, you will learn how to connect the MySQL database with Java file. We need to establish a connection between MySQL and Java files so that we can use MySQL driver for MySQL.

Creating a Database in MySQL
After establishing the connection with MySQL database by using the JDBC driver, you will learn how we can create our database.

Creating a Database Table
Here, providing you an example with code and it’s description that helps you to create a database table in a database through the java file.

Creating a MySQL Database Table to store Java Types
Dear user, consider a case where we need to store a java types in our database table. This section describes how to create a MySQL database table that stores all java types.[/code]
I actually found that on google (www.google.ca) not the other RSPS comunities

Read full topic

item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Read up on what JDBC is and how to use it, that’s the Java Database Connectivity, which allows you to connect to MySQL and execute queries/updates on that MySQL server.
